body_html:
This is my proposed addition to the tf.gather doc in array_ops.cc:

validate_indices: DEPRECATED. If this operation is assigned to CPU, values in
indices are always validated to be within range. If assigned to GPU,
out-of-bound values in indices currently result in output values of 0.

Given @hholst80 's comment on Aug 5, 2016 above, and confirming by looking at the CPU and GPU .cc source, the above seems the most complete doc. We may prefer to avoid saying that current fallback value on GPU is 0, in case people start depending on it.

The above fix is in my fork at github.com/Fenugreek/tensorflow. I expect there will be comments resulting in changes, so I am holding off making a pull request.

The above fix is in my fork at github.com/Fenugreek/tensorflow. I expect there will be comments resulting in changes, so I am holding off making a pull request.
body:
This is my proposed addition to the `tf.gather` doc in array_ops.cc:

---

`validate_indices`: DEPRECATED. If this operation is assigned to CPU, values in 
`indices` are always validated to be within range. If assigned to GPU,
out-of-bound values in `indices` currently result in output values of `0`.

---
Given @hholst80 's comment on Aug 5, 2016 above, and confirming by looking at the CPU and GPU .cc source, the above seems the most complete doc. We may prefer to avoid saying that current fallback value on GPU is `0`, in case people start depending on it.

The above fix is in my fork at `github.com/Fenugreek/tensorflow`. I expect there will be comments resulting in changes, so I am holding off making a pull request.
